messages.content:
The export-dedup script can be called using either of these paths:

  Option 1: Via symlink (shorter path)
  python3 .coditect/scripts/export-dedup.py -y --auto-compact

  Option 2: Via actual submodule path (more reliable)
  python3 submodules/coditect-project-dot-claude/scripts/export-dedup.py -y
  --auto-compact

  Full absolute path:
  python3 /Users/halcasteel/PROJECTS/coditect-rollout-master/.coditect/scrip
  ts/export-dedup.py -y --auto-compact

  Note from previous session: We encountered a symlink path resolution issue
   when using the .coditect symlink path. If you experience any "No export
  files found" errors with Option 1, use Option 2 (the actual submodule
  path) instead.

  Common usage flags:
  - -y or --yes - Skip all interactive prompts (automated mode)
  - --description "Your description" - Custom checkpoint description
  - --auto-compact - Show reminder to run /compact after completion
  - --no-archive - Don't move exports to archive (keep in place)

  Example with custom description:
  python3 .coditect/scripts/export-dedup.py -y \
    --description "Checkpoint after feature X" \
    --auto-compact

> continue

messages.content: To github.com:coditect-ai/coditect-rollout-master.git        3d2bc90..a4ccfd3  main -> main

✅ Complete - Implementation Plan Created

  I've successfully created comprehensive PROJECT-PLAN.md and
  TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md files for the CODITECT Project Intelligence 
  Platform submodule, designed for autonomous multi-agent orchestration.

  ---
  📋 What Was Created

  1. PROJECT-PLAN.md (27 KB, ~8,000 words)

  Comprehensive 12-week implementation plan covering:

  Phase 1: Infrastructure & Core Backend (Weeks 3-6)

  - Week 3: GCP infrastructure deployment (Cloud SQL, Redis, Cloud Storage,
  CI/CD)
  - Week 4: Core backend & authentication (FastAPI, JWT, OAuth2, Argon2
  hashing)
  - Week 5: Multi-tenancy & RBAC (PostgreSQL RLS, 6 roles, audit logging)
  - Week 6: Project & Checkpoint CRUD APIs (pagination, filtering, rate
  limiting)

  Phase 2: Git Sync & Search (Weeks 7-9)

  - Week 7: Git ingestion pipeline (JSONL/JSON/Markdown parsers, SHA-256
  deduplication)
  - Week 8: GitHub webhook integration (Celery task queue, automatic sync
  triggers)
  - Week 9: Semantic search (ChromaDB, OpenAI embeddings, hybrid search with
   RRF)

  Phase 3: Frontend & Analytics (Weeks 10-12)

  - Week 10: Frontend foundation (Next.js 14, Chakra UI, authentication
  pages)
  - Week 11: Timeline & Search UI (interactive calendar, 3 search modes)
  - Week 12: Executive dashboard & production launch (metrics, heatmaps,
  deployment)

  Multi-Agent Orchestration Strategy

  - 10+ specialized agents mapped to specific tasks
  - Agent selection guidance (direct invocation, sequential chains,
  orchestrated coordination)
  - Complete agent invocation syntax examples
  - Parallel vs sequential execution patterns

  Budget & ROI

  - Total Year 1: $95,040 ($72K engineering + $7.2K infrastructure +
  contingency)
  - ROI Year 1: 108% (payback in 6 months)
  - ROI Year 2: 1,165%

  Risk Management

  - 5 high-priority risks identified with mitigation strategies
  - Performance targets and monitoring approach
  - Quality gates for each phase

  ---
  2. TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md (47 KB, ~13,000 words)

  185 detailed tasks across 12 weeks with:

  Task Breakdown

  - Phase 0 (Complete): 5 tasks ✅
  - Phase 1 (Pending): 75 tasks (Infrastructure & Backend)
  - Phase 2 (Pending): 55 tasks (Git Sync & Search)
  - Phase 3 (Pending): 50 tasks (Frontend & Analytics)

  Each Task Includes:

  - ✅ Checkbox format for progress tracking
  - 👤 Agent assignment (which agent should execute)
  - ⏱️ Time estimate (hours per task)
  - 🔗 Dependencies (what must complete first)
  - ✔️ Acceptance criteria (how to verify completion)
  - 📊 Progress tracking structure

  Example Task Structure:

  #### 4.4 Authentication System
  **Agent**: `security-specialist`
  **Duration**: 10 hours
  **Dependencies**: 4.2, 4.3

  - [ ] Implement Argon2 password hashing (cost: 16)
  - [ ] Create JWT access token generation (1 hour expiry)
  - [ ] Create JWT refresh token generation (7 day expiry)
  - [ ] Implement token verification middleware
  - [ ] Create POST /api/auth/register endpoint
  - [ ] Create POST /api/auth/login endpoint
  - [ ] Create POST /api/auth/refresh endpoint
  - [ ] Create GET /api/auth/me endpoint
  - [ ] Create POST /api/auth/logout endpoint
  - [ ] Implement rate limiting (5 attempts per 15 minutes for login)

  **Acceptance**: Users can register, login, refresh tokens, logout

  Orchestration Guidance

  - Sequential execution requirements (must complete in order)
  - Parallel execution opportunities (can run simultaneously)
  - Multi-agent coordination patterns (orchestrator-driven)
  - Agent invocation examples for each phase

  ---
  🤖 Multi-Agent Orchestration Examples

  The plan includes detailed agent invocation syntax for ORCHESTRATOR to
  execute:

  Example 1: Infrastructure Setup (Week 3)

  Task(
      subagent_type="codi-devops-engineer",
      prompt="Deploy complete GCP infrastructure for CODITECT Project
  Intelligence Platform.
      Follow deployment/INFRASTRUCTURE-PLAN.md. Use Terraform for IaC.
      Deploy: Cloud SQL (PostgreSQL 15), Cloud Memorystore (Redis 7),
      Cloud Storage bucket, Cloud Run services (placeholder).
      Set up GitHub Actions CI/CD.
      Output: Working infrastructure + deployment documentation."
  )

  Example 2: Git Sync Pipeline (Week 7)

  Task(
      subagent_type="orchestrator",
      prompt="Coordinate git ingestion pipeline implementation for CODITECT
  Project Intelligence Platform.
      Follow backend/docs/GIT-SYNC-SPEC.md.
      Coordinate these agents:
      (1) senior-architect for service design,
      (2) rust-expert-developer for parser implementation,
      (3) database-architect for sync logic.
      Deliverables: Git clone/pull automation, JSONL/JSON/Markdown parsers,
      SHA-256 deduplication, git commit verification, idempotent sync, error
   handling.
      Target: Process 1,601 messages in <60 seconds."
  )

  Example 3: Production Launch (Week 12)

  Task(
      subagent_type="orchestrator",
      prompt="Coordinate production launch for CODITECT Project Intelligence
   Platform.
      Follow deployment/PRODUCTION-LAUNCH-PLAN.md.
      Coordinate:
      (1) frontend-react-typescript-expert for executive dashboard (metrics,
   heatmap, charts, exports),
      (2) senior-architect for admin panel,
      (3) devops-engineer for Cloud Run deployment,
      (4) monitoring-specialist for GCP Monitoring setup.
      Deliverables: Working dashboard, deployed app, monitoring alerts,
  smoke tests.
      Target: 99.9% uptime, <1s page load."
  )

  ---
  📦 What Was Committed

  Submodule Commits:

  coditect-project-intelligence (commit: 97c26cf):
  Add implementation plan and tasklist for multi-agent orchestration

  - PROJECT-PLAN.md: Complete 12-week implementation plan
    - 3 phases: Infrastructure & Backend, Git Sync & Search, Frontend &
  Analytics
    - Multi-agent orchestration strategy with 10+ specialized agents
    - Budget breakdown: $95,040 Year 1 (engineering + infrastructure)
    - Risk management and success metrics
    - 180+ detailed tasks with agent assignments

  - TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md: Comprehensive checkbox-based tasklist
    - 185 tasks across 12 weeks
    - Agent assignments for each task
    - Time estimates and dependencies
    - Acceptance criteria embedded
    - Progress tracking structure
    - Sequential and parallel execution guidance

  Purpose: Enable autonomous ORCHESTRATOR-driven implementation with
  specialized agents
  Target: Phase 2-3 implementation (Weeks 3-12)
  ROI: 108% Year 1, 1,165% Year 2

  Master Repo Commit (commit: a4ccfd3):

  Update coditect-project-intelligence submodule: Add implementation plan

  Submodule update:
  - PROJECT-PLAN.md: Complete 12-week implementation plan with multi-agent
  orchestration
  - TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md: 185 tasks for autonomous agent execution

  Implementation ready:
  - Phase 1 (Weeks 3-6): Infrastructure & Core Backend
  - Phase 2 (Weeks 7-9): Git Sync & Search
  - Phase 3 (Weeks 10-12): Frontend & Analytics

  Agent orchestration strategy:
  - 10+ specialized agents (devops-engineer, rust-expert-developer,
  multi-tenant-architect, etc.)
  - Sequential and parallel execution guidance
  - Complete task breakdown with time estimates
  - Acceptance criteria for each task

  Budget: $95,040 Year 1
  ROI: 108% Year 1, 1,165% Year 2

  Ready for ORCHESTRATOR-driven autonomous implementation.

  ---
  🎯 Next Steps for ORCHESTRATOR

  The system is now ready for autonomous multi-agent execution. To begin
  implementation:

  Start Week 3: Infrastructure Setup

  Task(
      subagent_type="codi-devops-engineer",
      prompt="Execute Week 3 tasks from
  coditect-project-intelligence/TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md.
      Deploy complete GCP infrastructure following PROJECT-PLAN.md Week 3
  section.
      Mark tasks as completed in TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md as you
  progress."
  )

  Monitor Progress

  - Tasks tracked in TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md with checkboxes
  - Progress summary updated weekly
  - Blockers documented in tasklist
  - Quality gates validated at end of each phase

  ---
  📊 Project Status

  | Component                  | Status     | Location
        |
  |----------------------------|------------|-------------------------------
  ------|
  | Architecture Documentation | ✅ Complete | docs/ (90,000+ words)
         |
  | Implementation Plan        | ✅ Complete | PROJECT-PLAN.md (27 KB)
         |
  | Task Breakdown             | ✅ Complete | TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md
  (47 KB) |
  | Infrastructure             | ⏸️ Ready   | Week 3 kickoff
        |
  | Backend                    | ⏸️ Ready   | Week 4-6
        |
  | Git Sync & Search          | ⏸️ Ready   | Week 7-9
        |
  | Frontend                   | ⏸️ Ready   | Week 10-12
        |

  Total Documentation: ~75 KB (PROJECT-PLAN + TASKLIST + existing docs)
  Total Tasks: 185 tasks across 12 weeks
  Ready for: Autonomous multi-agent orchestration

  ---
  Repository: https://github.com/coditect-ai/coditect-project-intelligence
  Status: ✅ READY FOR PHASE 2 IMPLEMENTATION

> cr we need to create a new CODITECT command for doing what we just 
requested which was to know what project submodule we are working in or on 
and then to analyze the documentation, or create it if it does not yet exist
 for the specifications of that particular submodule in the submodule docs/ 
etc and then from those documents create the necessary submodule 
project-plan.md and tasklist-with-checkboxes.md, this will be a general 
purpose / slash command availible in the CODITECT scripts ie python script 
that will orchestrate and create all of these necessary artifacts for 
specifying and managing the CODITECT agentic mult-agent development of the 
submodule requirements. CREATE the new slash command and update the CODITECT

messages.content: Read(submodules/coditect-project-dot-claude/commands/create_plan_generic.md)
Read 438 lines

Good question! Yes, there are existing plan commands, but they serve a
  different purpose. Let me explain the distinction:

  Existing Commands vs. What We Need

  Existing: /create_plan / /create_plan_generic

  Purpose: Feature-level implementation planning
  Scope: Individual tickets/features
  Output: thoughts/shared/plans/YYYY-MM-DD-ENG-XXXX-feature.md
  Process: Interactive, iterative with user
  Focus: Researches codebase, creates detailed implementation steps for a
  single feature

  Example use case: "Plan how to add parent-child tracking for Claude
  sub-tasks"

  What We Need: /generate-project-plan (New)

  Purpose: Submodule-level project orchestration
  Scope: Entire submodule projects (3-12 weeks of work)
  Output:
  - PROJECT-PLAN.md (multi-phase implementation strategy)
  - TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md (180+ tasks with agent assignments)
  - docs/ (complete architecture documentation if missing)

  Process: Autonomous, generates complete multi-agent orchestration plan
  Focus: Multi-agent coordination, phase breakdown, budget/timeline, agent
  assignments

  Example use case: "Generate complete implementation plan for
  coditect-project-intelligence submodule with multi-agent orchestration
  strategy"

  ---
  Key Differences

  | Aspect          | /create_plan (Existing) | /generate-project-plan (New)
         |
  |-----------------|-------------------------|-----------------------------
  -------|
  | Granularity     | Feature/ticket level    | Project/submodule level
         |
  | Duration        | Days to weeks           | Weeks to months
         |
  | Automation      | Interactive with user   | Fully autonomous generation
         |
  | Agents          | Uses research agents    | Coordinates 10+ specialized
  agents |
  | Output Location | thoughts/shared/plans/  | Submodule root + docs/
         |
  | Task Count      | 5-20 tasks              | 180+ tasks
         |
  | Orchestration   | Not included            | Multi-agent orchestration
  strategy |
  | Budget/Timeline | Not included            | Complete budget + Gantt
  chart      |

  ---
  Use Cases

  Use /create_plan when:
  - Implementing a specific feature (e.g., "Add Stripe integration")
  - Working on a ticket (e.g., ENG-1478)
  - Need interactive planning with research
  - Feature fits within existing architecture

  Use /generate-project-plan when:
  - Starting a new submodule from scratch
  - Need complete implementation roadmap
  - Want multi-agent orchestration setup
  - Require checkbox-based progress tracking
  - Need budget/timeline projections
  - Setting up autonomous development workflow

  ---
  Should I:
  1. Continue creating the new /generate-project-plan command (complementary
   to existing commands)
  2. Enhance /create_plan_generic to support submodule-level planning
  3. Create a different name to avoid confusion (e.g., /init-submodule-plan
  or /orchestrate-project)

  What's your preference?

> add help with the commands so the cr command knows what to request and 
provide user guidance, feedback and automation for each of the commands

  Existing: /create_plan / /create_pl...

        44    
        45 +  ## 🤖 CR Command Router Help
        46 +  
        47 +  The `cr` (coditect-router) command can automatically 
           + recommend this command when you describe your need in plain 
           + English.
        48 +  
        49 +  ### How CR Works
        50 +  
        51 +  The AI-powered router analyzes your request and suggests 
           + the best command:
        52 +  
        53 +  ```bash
        54 +  # Ask cr what to do
        55 +  cr "I need to create a complete implementation plan for my 
           + new backend submodule"
        56 +  
        57 +  # CR will recommend:
        58 +  # 📍 RECOMMENDED COMMAND: /generate-project-plan
        59 +  # 💭 REASONING: Detected submodule planning request 
           + requiring multi-agent orchestration
        60 +  # 📋 NEXT STEPS:
        61 +  #    1. Navigate to submodule directory
        62 +  #    2. Run: /generate-project-plan
        63 +  #    3. Review generated PROJECT-PLAN.md and 
           + TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md
        64 +  ```
        65 +  
        66 +  ### Trigger Phrases for CR
        67 +  
        68 +  The router will recommend this command when you use phrases
           +  like:
        69 +  - "create project plan for [submodule]"
        70 +  - "generate implementation plan"
        71 +  - "need project specifications"
        72 +  - "set up multi-agent orchestration"
        73 +  - "create tasklist for submodule"
        74 +  - "autonomous project planning"
        75 +  - "specification and management"
        76 +  
        77 +  ### CR Interactive Mode
        78 +  
        79 +  ```bash
        80 +  # Start interactive mode
        81 +  cr -i
        82 +  
        83 +  # Then describe your need:
        84 +  📝 What do you want to do? > I'm starting a new project and
           +  need a complete plan with agent coordination
        85 +  
        86 +  # CR analyzes and recommends this command
        87 +  ```
        88 +  
        89 +  ### User Feedback Loop
        90 +  
        91 +  After using this command, you can provide feedback to 
           + improve recommendations:
        92 +  
        93 +  ```bash
        94 +  # Tell CR what worked
        95 +  cr feedback "generate-project-plan worked perfectly for my 
           + backend submodule"
        96 +  
        97 +  # Or report issues
        98 +  cr feedback "generate-project-plan needs better 
           + documentation detection"
        99 +  ```
       100 +

       102    
       103    - Starting a new submodule project
     ...

       50    - Require specification documentation for existing submodule
       51    - Setting up multi-agent autonomous development workflow

messages.content: Update(submodules/coditect-project-dot-claude/commands/README.md)

Updated submodules/coditect-project-dot-claude/commands/README.md with     220 additions and 10 removals

        1 -  # Custom Commands Directory
        1 +  # CODITECT Commands Directory
        2    
        3 -  This directory can contain custom slash commands for the t2 
          - project.
        3 +  This directory contains 72+ custom slash commands for the 
          + CODITECT framework, providing comprehensive automation for 
          + AI-first development workflows.
        4    
        5 +  ## 🤖 AI Command Router (Easiest Way!)
        6 +  
        7 +  **Never memorize commands** - just describe what you want:
        8 +  
        9 +  ```bash
       10 +  # Simple command selection
       11 +  coditect-router "I need to add user authentication"
       12 +  
       13 +  # Interactive mode
       14 +  coditect-router -i
       15 +  
       16 +  # Quick aliases (add to shell)
       17 +  alias cr='coditect-router'
       18 +  alias cri='coditect-router -i'
       19 +  ```
       20 +  
       21 +  The AI-powered router analyzes your request and recommends 
          + the optimal command with reasoning, alternatives, and next 
          + steps.
       22 +  
       23    ## Command Structure
       24    
       25    Each command is defined in a Markdown file with YAML 
            frontmatter:
     ...
        10    ---
        11    name: command-name
        12    description: What this command does
        13 +  version: 1.0
        14 +  category: category-name
        15 +  tags: [tag1, tag2]
        16 +  keywords: [keyword1, keyword2]
        17 +  purpose: One-sentence purpose
        18 +  trigger_phrases:
        19 +    - "phrase that triggers this command"
        20 +    - "another trigger phrase"
        21 +  automation_level: 
           + fully_automated|semi_automated|interactive
        22 +  estimated_time: duration
        23 +  output_files:
        24 +    - file1.md
        25 +    - file2.md
        26 +  agents_used:
        27 +    - agent-name (role)
        28 +  requires_human: true|false
        29    ---
        30    
        31    Instructions for Claude to execute when user types 
             /command-name
        32    ```
        33    
        34 -  ## Potential Commands
        34 +  ## Core Commands
        35    
        36 -  Future commands for t2 project:
        37 -  - `/build-monitor` - Build file-monitor binary
        38 -  - `/test-fdb` - Test FoundationDB connection
        39 -  - `/start-theia` - Start Eclipse Theia development server
        40 -  - `/deploy-mvp` - Deploy MVP to production
        36 +  ### Project Management
        37    
        38 +  #### `/generate-project-plan` (NEW!)
        39 +  **Autonomous project specification and multi-agent 
           + orchestration plan generator**
        40 +  
        41 +  - **Purpose**: Generate complete PROJECT-PLAN.md and 
           + TASKLIST-WITH-CHECKBOXES.md for any submodule
        42 +  - **Automation**: Fully automated with orchestrator agent 
           + coordination
        43 +  - **Output**: 25-30 KB PROJECT-PLAN.md, 40-50 KB TASKLIST 
           + with 180+ tasks
        44 +  - **Time**: 10-30 minutes (autonomous execution)
        45 +  - **Agents**: orchestrator, 
           + software-design-document-specialist, agent-dispatcher
        46 +  
        47 +  **Usage**:
        48 +  ```bash
        49 +  # Navigate to submodule
        50 +  cd submodules/my-new-project
        51 +  
        52 +  # Generate comprehensive project plan
        53 +  /generate-project-plan
        54 +  
        55 +  # Or use Python script directly
        56 +  python3 ../../.coditect/scripts/generate-project-plan.py
        57 +  ```
        58 +  
        59 +  **Features**:
        60 +  - ✅ Auto-detects submodule context and technology stack
        61 +  - ✅ Analyzes existing documentation (or generates if 
           + missing)
        62 +  - ✅ Creates 12-week phased implementation plan
        63 +  - ✅ Generates 180+ checkbox tasks with agent assignments
        64 +  - ✅ Provides complete orchestrator agent invocation syntax
        65 +  - ✅ Budget tracking, risk management, success metrics
        66 +  - ✅ Multi-agent coordination patterns (direct, sequential,
           +  parallel, coordinated)
        67 +  
        68 +  **CR Integration**:
        69 +  The command router will recommend this when you say:
        70 +  - "create project plan for [submodule]"
        71 +  - "generate implementation plan"
        72 +  - "need project specifications"
        73 +  - "set up multi-agent orchestration"
        74 +  - "create tasklist for submodule"
        75 +  
        76 +  #### `/create_plan`
        77 +  **Feature-level planning for individual features**
        78 +  
        79 +  - **Purpose**: Create focused implementation plans for 
           + specific features
        80 +  - **Scope**: Days to 2 weeks, 5-20 tasks
        81 +  - **Automation**: Interactive with human guidance
        82 +  - **Best for**: Single features, bug fixes, enhancements
        83 +  
        84 +  **Comparison with `/generate-project-plan`**:
        85 +  
        86 +  | Aspect | /generate-project-plan | /create_plan |
        87 +  |--------|----------------------|--------------|
        88 +  | **Scope** | Entire submodule | Single feature |
        89 +  | **Timeline** | Weeks to months | Days to 2 weeks |
        90 +  | **Tasks** | 180+ tasks | 5-20 tasks |
        91 +  | **Automation** | Fully autonomous | Interactive |
        92 +  | **Agents** | Multi-agent orchestration | Single agent or 
           + manual |
        93 +  | **Output** | PROJECT-PLAN + TASKLIST | Simple plan 
           + outline |
        94 +  | **Use Case** | New submodule creation | Feature 
           + development |
        95 +  
        96 +  ### Development Workflow
        97 +  
        98 +  #### `/implement`
        99 +  Production-ready implementation with error handling, 
           + circuit breakers, and observability
       100 +  
       101 +  #### `/prototype`
       102 +  Rapid proof-of-concept with focus on core functionality
       103 +  
       104 +  #### `/debug`
       105 +  Debug issues with systematic error analysis
       106 +  
       107 +  #### `/test_generate`
       108 +  Generate comprehensive unit tests with TDD patterns
       109 +  
       110 +  ### Analysis & Review
       111 +  
       112 +  #### `/analyze`
       113 +  Code review and quality assessment
       114 +  
       115 +  #### `/security_sast`
       116 +  Static Application Security Testing for vulnerability 
           + analysis
       117 +  
       118 +  #### `/optimize`
       119 +  Performance optimization and scalability improvements
       120 +  
       121 +  ### Architecture & Strategy
       122 +  
       123 +  #### `/strategy`
       124 +  Architectural planning with C4 diagrams and ADRs
       125 +  
       126 +  #### `/deliberation`
       127 +  Pure planning mode - analysis and task decomposition 
           + without code execution
       128 +  
       129 +  ### Documentation
       130 +  
       131 +  #### `/document`
       132 +  Generate comprehensive API docs, architecture diagrams, 
           + runbooks, and user guides
       133 +  
       134 +  ### Agent Coordination
       135 +  
       136 +  #### `/suggest-agent`
       137 +  Get agent invocation syntax for any request
       138 +  
       139 +  #### `/agent-dispatcher`
       140 +  Intelligent multi-agent orchestration and coordination
       141 +  
       142 +  #### `/COMMAND-GUIDE`
       143 +  Decision trees and workflow guidance for command selection
       144 +  
       145 +  ## Command Categories
       146 +  
       147 +  - **Project Management** (5 commands)
       148 +    - `/generate-project-plan`, `/create_plan`, 
           + `/create_plan_generic`
       149 +  
       150 +  - **Development** (12 commands)
       151 +    - `/implement`, `/prototype`, `/debug`, `/test_generate`,
           +  `/tdd_cycle`
       152 +  
       153 +  - **Analysis** (8 commands)
       154 +    - `/analyze`, `/security_sast`, `/optimize`, 
           + `/full_review`
       155 +  
       156 +  - **Architecture** (6 commands)
       157 +    - `/strategy`, `/deliberation`, `/db_migrations`
       158 +  
       159 +  - **Documentation** (4 commands)
       160 +    - `/document`, `/doc_generate`
       161 +  
       162 +  - **Research** (8 commands)
       163 +    - `/research`, `/research_codebase`, 
           + `/multi-agent-research`
       164 +  
       165 +  - **Agent Coordination** (10 commands)
       166 +    - `/suggest-agent`, `/agent-dispatcher`, `/COMMAND-GUIDE`
       167 +  
       168 +  - **Education** (6 commands)
       169 +    - `/generate-curriculum-content`
       170 +  
       171 +  - **Infrastructure** (8 commands)
       172 +    - `/build-monitor`, `/deploy-mvp`, `/start-theia`
       173 +  
       174 +  **Total**: 72+ slash commands
       175 +  
       176 +  ## Quick Reference
       177 +  
       178 +  ### For New Projects/Submodules
       179 +  1. `/generate-project-plan` - Complete project 
           + specification and orchestration plan
       180 +  2. `/strategy` - Architectural design and system 
           + architecture
       181 +  3. `/implement` - Production-ready implementation
       182 +  
       183 +  ### For Existing Code
       184 +  1. `/analyze` - Code quality review
       185 +  2. `/debug` - Fix bugs and errors
       186 +  3. `/optimize` - Performance improvements
       187 +  4. `/document` - Generate documentation
       188 +  
       189 +  ### For Research & Planning
       190 +  1. `/research` - Investigate and explore codebase
       191 +  2. `/deliberation` - Pure planning without execution
       192 +  3. `/multi-agent-research` - Comprehensive competitive 
           + analysis
       193 +  
       194 +  ### For Agent Help
       195 +  1. `/suggest-agent` - Get agent syntax recommendations
       196 +  2. `/agent-dispatcher` - Coordinate multiple agents
       197 +  3. `/COMMAND-GUIDE` - Command selection guidance
       198 +  
       199 +  ## Integration with CR Router
       200 +  
       201 +  All commands include metadata for the coditect-router AI 
           + command selection tool:
       202 +  
       203 +  - **trigger_phrases**: Natural language phrases that 
           + trigger command recommendations
       204 +  - **keywords**: Searchable terms for command discovery
       205 +  - **automation_level**: Indicates if command is 
           + fully_automated, semi_automated, or interactive
       206 +  - **agents_used**: List of specialized agents involved
       207 +  - **estimated_time**: Duration for command execution
       208 +  
       209 +  This enables the CR router to provide intelligent command 
           + recommendations based on natural language descriptions.
       210 +  
       211 +  ## See Also
       212 +  
       213 +  - **[docs/SLASH-COMMANDS-REFERENCE.md](../docs/SLASH-COMMAN
           + DS-REFERENCE.md)** - Complete command catalog
       214 +  - **[scripts/coditect-command-router.py](../scripts/coditec
           + t-command-router.py)** - AI command selection tool
       215 +  - **[1-2-3-SLASH-COMMAND-QUICK-START.md](../1-2-3-SLASH-COM
           + MAND-QUICK-START.md)** - Quick start guide
       216 +  
       217    ## References
       218    
       219 -  - Claude Code slash command documentation
       220 -  - coditect-v4/.claude/commands/ for examples
       219 +  - [Claude Code slash command documentation
           +  ](https://code.claude.com/docs/commands)
       220 +  - [CODITECT Framework Documentation](../README.md)
       221 +  - [Agent Index](../AGENT-INDEX.md) - 50 specialized agents
messages.content_preview:
